thread.title: 2 middle school coaches, 4 students arrested after sexual behavior captured on bus video
thread.title_full: 2 middle school coaches, 4 students arrested after sexual behavior captured on bus video

author: Darla Guillen, Houston Chronicle
title: 2 middle school coaches, 4 students arrested after sexual behavior captured on bus video
text:
Tyler Reid JohnsonMcNeil High School, Round Rock Reid, an educational assistant, was arrested on April 20, 2016, and charged with two counts of sexual assault of a child and two counts of improper relationship between educator and student. He allegedly performed oral sex on a 15-year-old female student at a playground and had sex twice with a second student. She was arrested on April 7, 2016, by Texas Rangers on a Class A misdemeanor charge of distribution of harmful material to a minor. The former teacher and baseball coach who played for the Oklahoma Sooners allegedly assaulted a female student three times in August 2015 when she was 16. One of the students told police that Kent told her he would "scuff" her unless she performed oral sex on him, to which she refused, according to media reports. He allegedly had been dating a 17-year-old female Sharpstown student since June 2015, according to court documents, and allegations of inappropriate conduct were first reported in February 2016. Aldo Leiva Sharpstown High School, Houston Leiva, 51, a former tutor in the Houston Independent School District, faces a felony charge of sexual performance by a child and possession of child pornography. He ... more Image 26 of 26 2 middle school coaches, 4 students arrested after sexual behavior captured on bus video 1 / 26 Back to Gallery 
Two middle school basketball coaches and four students have been arrested following allegations of sexual misconduct on a school bus ride Jan. 26. 
Midland I.S.D. administrators voted Monday to fire two Goddard Junior High School coaches, Irving Gomez and Rogelio Gutierrez, who have been charged with tampering or fabricating physical evidence. 
According to an affidavit obtained by CBS 7 News, basketball players at the middle school were returning from a game when students began bullying two boys on the bus. They simulated sexual behavior, stripped one boy down to his underwear and taunted the pair while the coaches did nothing to stop it. 
Surveillance footage from the bus validated the allegations. According to News West, the video also recorded one student saying, "help me." Another said "We (expletive) the (expletive) out of you," while both coaches neglected to help the students. 
ARRESTED: Texas student accused of blackmailing teacher after alleged sexual relationship 
Gomez, who is also an eighth-grade teacher at the school, was driving the bus. He allegedly yelled homosexual slurs and told them to "keep it in their pants." Gutierrez, who was seen on his cell phone, did nothing to stop the abuse. 
Gutierrez could be heard saying: "Ain't funny. Y'all better not put this on social media!" and added that "he wasn't going to jail for any of you (expletive)." He also instructed the boys, some of whom were capturing the acts on their cell phone, to delete anything they might have posted. 
GROWING PROBLEM IN TEXAS: Texas seeing boom in teacher-student sex scandals 
The coaches allegedly held back the students, telling them to explain to their parents that they were having a team meeting, presumably in an attempt to protect themselves. 
"Evidence of the behavior discovered during our investigation requires immediate action. I appreciate our police department and all district staff involved in this investigation for their professionalism and immediate attention to this matter. Their approach proves that the safety of our students is our number one priority and we will go above and beyond in protecting our students from any threat to their safety while in our care," said Mr. Rod Schroder, MISD Superintendent said .
